com.swoval.files

Interface FileCache<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of data stored in the Directory.Entry instances for the cache
    All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public interface FileCache<T>
extends java.lang.AutoCloseable
    Provides an in memory cache of portions of the file system. Directories are added to the cache using the register(Path, boolean) method. Once a Path is added the cache, its contents may be retrieved using the list(Path, boolean, Directory.EntryFilter) method. The cache stores the path information in Directory.Entry instances.

    A default implementation is provided by FileCaches.get(com.swoval.files.Directory.Converter<T>, com.swoval.files.FileCaches.Option...). The user may cache arbitrary information in the cache by customizing the Directory.Converter that is passed into the factory FileCaches.get(com.swoval.files.Directory.Converter<T>, com.swoval.files.FileCaches.Option...).

    The cache allows the user to register a regular file, directory or symbolic link. After registration, the cache should monitor the path (and in the case of symbolic links, the target of the link) for updates. Whenever an update is detected, the cache updates its internal representation of the file system. When that is complete, it will notify all of the registered Observers of the change. In general, the update that is sent in the callback will be visible if the user lists the relevant path. It is however, possible that if the file is being updated rapidly that the internal state of the cache may change in between the callback being invoked and the user listing the path. Once the file system activity settles down, the cache should always end up in a consistent state where it mirrors the state of the file system.

    The semantics of the list method are very similar to the linux `ls` tool. Listing a directory returns all of the subdirectories and files contained in the directory and the empty list if the directory is empty. Listing a file, however, will return the entry for the file if it exists and the empty list otherwise.

      • list

        java.util.List<Directory.Entry<T>> list(java.nio.file.Path path,
                                        int maxDepth,
                                        Directory.EntryFilter<? super T> filter)
        Lists the cache elements in the particular path
        Parameters:
        path - The path to list. This may be a file in which case the result list contains only this path or the empty list if the path is not monitored by the cache.
        maxDepth - The maximum depth of children of the parent to traverse in the tree.
        filter - Only include cache entries that are accepted by the filter.
        Returns:
        The list of cache elements. This will be empty if the path is not monitored in a monitored path. If the path is a file and the file is monitored by the cache, the returned list will contain just the cache entry for the path.

      • list

        java.util.List<Directory.Entry<T>> list(java.nio.file.Path path,
                                        boolean recursive,
                                        Directory.EntryFilter<? super T> filter)
        Lists the cache elements in the particular path
        Parameters:
        path - The path to list. This may be a file in which case the result list contains only this path or the empty list if the path is not monitored by the cache.
        recursive - Toggles whether or not to include paths in subdirectories. Even when the cache is recursively monitoring the input path, it will not return cache entries for children if this flag is false.
        filter - Only include cache entries that are accepted by the filter.
        Returns:
        The list of cache elements. This will be empty if the path is not monitored in a monitored path. If the path is a file and the file is monitored by the cache, the returned list will contain just the cache entry for the path.

        Returns:

      • register

        Either<java.io.IOException,java.lang.Boolean> register(java.nio.file.Path path,
                                                       int maxDepth)
        Register the path for monitoring.
        Parameters:
        path - The path to monitor
        maxDepth - The maximum depth of subdirectories to include
        Returns:
        an instance of Either that contains a boolean flag indicating whether registration succeeds. If an IOException is thrown registering the path, it is returned as a Either.Left. This method should be idempotent and returns false if the call was a no-op.

      • register

        Either<java.io.IOException,java.lang.Boolean> register(java.nio.file.Path path,
                                                       boolean recursive)
        Register the path for monitoring.
        Parameters:
        path - The path to monitor
        recursive - Recursively monitor the path if true
        Returns:
        an instance of Either that contains a boolean flag indicating whether registration succeeds. If an IOException is thrown registering the path, it is returned as a Either.Left. This method should be idempotent and returns false if the call was a no-op.

      • register

        Either<java.io.IOException,java.lang.Boolean> register(java.nio.file.Path path)
        Register the path for monitoring recursively.
        Parameters:
        path - The path to monitor
        Returns:
        an instance of Either that contains a boolean flag indicating whether registration succeeds. If an IOException is thrown registering the path, it is returned as a Either.Left. This method should be idempotent and returns false if the call was a no-op.

      • unregister

        void unregister(java.nio.file.Path path)
        Unregister a path from the cache. This removes the path from monitoring and from the cache so long as the path isn't covered by another registered path. For example, if the path /foo was previously registered, after removal, no changes to /foo or files in /foo should be detected by the cache. Moreover, calling list(Path) for /foo should return an empty list. If, however, we register both /foo recursively and /foo/bar (recursively or not), after unregistering /foo/bar, changes to /foo/bar should continue to be detected and /foo/bar should be included in the list returned by list(Path).
        Parameters:
        path - The path to unregister
